column3: lies down beside her. He kisses her again
column5: lingeringly. Then he asks what time it is. He himself has no watch. Lesje tells him it’s five-thirty. He sits up. Lesje is beginning to feel slightly unattractive. Are her teeth too large

column1: 1730|half-past five|It was half-past five before Holmes returned. He was bright
column4: a mood which in his case alternated with fits of the blackest depression.

column1:
1730|five-thirty|How could anyone say no to Erin Cook?
Well
column2: God said no. God burned Tom Kennedy’s lot
column3: and He burned hers in the process. When I picked up the phone at five-thirty on a gorgeous October afternoon in Westchester
column4: that girl had become a woman whose voice
column6: sounded old and tired to death.

column3: Eva’s red-and-white bobber plunked below the water
column4: and her thin green rod bowed with an invigorating weight. It was another one of the gold-and-brown guys

column1: 1730|half-past five|He went up to his coachman
column2: who was dozing on the box in the shadow
column4: of a thick lime-tree; he admired the shifting clouds of midges circling over the hot horses
column8: and told him to drive to Bryansky’s. It was only after driving nearly five miles that he had sufficiently recovered himself to look at his watch
column9: and realise that it was half-past five

column1: 1730|5:30|October 6.— So as not to have too far to walk
column2: I go out about four intending to stop in at the "Nouvelle France
column3: where Nadja is supposed to meet me at 5:30. This gives me time to stroll around the boulevards not far from the Opéra, I have to pick up my pen from the shop where it is being repaired.
